stream_context.summary: Kaze uses a one-off YouTube stream (normally on Twitch) to build Course 1 “tutorial bunnies.”  He tweaks shading, writes code, designs textures, and prototypes a rotating particle ring that appears after the bunny’s dialog to teach new movement mechanics.

development_findings.summary: Added three “tutorial bunnies” in Course 1; each teaches a specific move (dive jump, wall-kick, spin jump) and rewards a coin after the player performs the move through a rotating ring that appears only after speaking to the bunny.
development_findings.quote: The tutorials need to be the most understandable way possible… This one’s going to teach you the dive jump… then a ring spawns and you have to dive through it.

development_findings.summary: Implemented a concentric particle-based ring (two counter-rotating sprite circles) to mark the target for each tutorial move, tuning speed and lifetime for readability.
development_findings.quote: Oh, that looks pretty… very nice.  We’ll use this as the ring you have to go through.

development_findings.summary: Created 64×64 indexed-color billboard textures showing ‘Z→A’, ‘A→A’, ‘Z→B’ button diagrams; discussed readability, anti-aliasing limits, and plan to rebuild them as separate textures for memory efficiency.
development_findings.quote: This texture should be illegal… but from this image, would you understand what to do?  I hope you would.

development_findings.summary: Optimised sine/cosine functions and arranged render code in 0x400-byte ‘I-cache blocks’; also performed D-cache tuning to keep N64 performance near 60 FPS in Course 1.
development_findings.quote: I have a block of code that’s always 0x400 bytes so all the rendering functions fit in the same I-cache.

development_findings.summary: Adjusted Course 1 geometry (climbable wall, easier gaps) and global shading; identified wrong light source when entering via debug warp and plans ray-cast lighting for Mario and lens flares.
development_findings.quote: Mario’s too dark in the ROM-hack… that’s because the debug warp adds the Bowser level light.  I might ray-cast toward the light direction.

development_findings.summary: Project is ~70 % complete; major engine upgrades are ‘mostly done’; code will be open-sourced on release.

context_findings.summary: Kaze insists tutorials be short and optional because free ROM-hack players have low patience budgets.
context_findings.quote: Players start with some amount of patience… because no one paid for your game, you can’t go over your patience budget.

context_findings.summary: Frustrated with Twitch’s mandatory ads; testing YouTube as an alternative but undecided about permanent move.
context_findings.quote: Twitch forces you to run an ad every 30 minutes… Let’s test out YouTube and see if chat is comfy.

context_findings.summary: Week-long Easter break from day job allows extra Thursday stream; mentions work–life balance.
Belief that game dev starts fun and turns into ‘pure torture,’ yet completion rate under 4 % motivates disciplined scope.
context_findings.quote: That’s the cycle of making games… that’s why I always tell people to start with a small project.

context_findings.summary: Acknowledges past Nintendo takedowns (tutorial videos, Climate-Change 64) and will open-source only at release.

biobak.summary: Provides real-time art critique (shading on grass edges, wood texture), suggests ring visuals, and volunteers to rebuild billboard textures to save memory.
biobak.quote: You get to make the billboards—you can make them even more understandable.

biobak.summary: Responsible for graphic revamps that ‘make Course 1 look prettier.’

zeina.summary: Shows a WIP Bowser-hit animation; Kaze notes pivot issue (rotating around wrong origin) and likes the bounce.
zeina.quote: It looks like he’s not rotating around his actual middle… everything except that point is good.

key_stories.title: Inventing the Tutorial Bunny System
key_stories.summary: Kaze wants newcomers to learn advanced moves organically.  He designs talking bunnies that spawn a visual prompt and a particle ring the player must traverse with the demonstrated move.
key_stories.challenge: Teach complex movement without intrusive text or manuals.
key_stories.process: Created bunny objects, wrote cut-scenes, built button-diagram textures, coded ring spawn logic, tuned particle effects, adjusted camera and collision.
key_stories.outcome: System works in-engine; animations and final textures scheduled for Saturday.
key_stories.key_quote: The tutorials need to be the most understandable way possible, but also non-intrusive.

key_stories.title: Streaming Platform Dilemma
key_stories.summary: Kaze tests YouTube because Twitch’s increasing ad load hurts viewer experience.
key_stories.challenge: Mandatory ads every 30 minutes on Twitch diminish his and viewers’ enjoyment.
key_stories.process: Unannounced Thursday YouTube stream to gauge retention, chat comfort, and moderation options.
key_stories.outcome: Positive turnout but decision deferred; acknowledges risk of dual-streaming bans.
key_stories.key_quote: Twitch forces you to run an ad every 30 minutes… If YouTube chat is comfy we might migrate.
